You are here:

SALESFORCE HELP
DOCS
VISUALFORCE B2B COMMERCE
Specify Shipping Options for Standard Checkout

For standard checkout, you can show estimated shipping costs and allow a buyer to request a delivery date from the Shipping section of the Checkout page. You can also integrate data from an external shipping service provider.

REQUIRED EDITIONS AND USER PERMISSIONS

Salesforce Compatibility

Salesforce Classic (not available in all orgs) and Lightning Experience for Enterprise, Performance, Unlimited, and Developer editions.




B2B Commerce Compatibility

B2B Commerce for Visualforce Winter ’21 (version 4.13)
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Spring ’20 (version 4.12)
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Summer ’19 (version 4.11)
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Spring ’19 (version 4.10)
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Summer ’18 (version 4.9)


USER PERMISSIONS NEEDED
To access CC Admin and change settings:	Access B2B Commerce for Visualforce Admin Settings permission set

You can manage the following options in the Shipping section of the Checkout page for standard checkout:

Shipping Method (1)
A picklist of the shipping methods that are available for your storefront. You can either:
Set up weight-based shipping methods using the B2B Commerce for Visualforce custom object, CC Shipping Rate. For more information, see Specify Shipping Rates for a Product.
Extend the ccrz.cc_api_ShippingAndHandling extension point class in the B2B Commerce for Visualforce API for implementing your specific shipping requirements, such as to integrate an external provider.

The estimated shipping cost is calculated from the shipping weight of products in the cart.

IMPORTANT The default CC Shipping Rate object and the shipping methods of the API are intended for demo purposes only, and specify only one shipping service provider. This default implementation isn’t intended to be used in a production org. To implement the shipping options that are specific to your solution's unique requirements, including support for multiple shipping providers, you can extend the default object and API classes. Work with your development team to override the default ccrz.cc_api_ShippingAndHandling.getShippingOptions extension point method for implementing your specific shipping experience during checkout. For more help with developing a shipping extension, submit a Support & Services case and request access to sample extension code.
Ship Complete (2)
A flag set on the corresponding CC Cart and CC Order records. Consider showing this field when you want to allow a buyer to defer shipment of their order until all items are ready to ship.
Ship Notes (3)
A free text field for a buyer to enter instructions, notes, or comments. This field is set on the corresponding CC Cart and CC Order records.
Requested Delivery Date (4)
A date picker widget that allows a buyer to select a date for delivery. Optionally, you can validate that a selected date is valid before the buyer can continue to the next checkout section. For more information, see Set Up the Requested Delivery Date Picker on the Checkout Page.
Terms and Conditions (5)
Information that you require a buyer to acknowledge before they can continue to the next checkout section, and a checkbox that enforces their acknowledgment. To manage the terms and conditions that you show to a buyer, edit records of the CC Terms custom object.

To manage the shipping options for standard checkout, update your storefront configuration settings.

On the CC Admin tab in your org, select your storefront (1).
In the Storefront Settings menu, select Configuration Settings (2).
From the Module picklist, select Shipping Options (3).
To show the shipping method picklist and the estimated shipping cost, find the Show Ship Options configuration (4), and make sure that its value is TRUE (5).
TIP
If the value is FALSE, click Override in the Action column. Enter TRUE for Value, and click Create.
If the configuration doesn't exist, click New , enter the following values in the New Page Setting window, and click Create.
FIELD	VALUE
Module	Shipping Options
Configuration	Show Ship Options
Page	all
Value	TRUE
To show the Ship Complete checkbox, find the Show Ship Complete configuration (6), and make sure that its value is TRUE (7).
TIP
If the value is FALSE, click Override in the Action column. Enter TRUE for Value, and click Create.
If the configuration doesn't exist, click New , enter the following values in the New Page Setting window, and click Create.
FIELD	VALUE
Module	Shipping Options
Configuration	Show Ship Complete
Page	all
Value	TRUE
To show the Shipping Notes field, find the Show Ship Notes configuration (8), and make sure that its value is TRUE (9).
TIP
If the value is FALSE, click Override in the Action column. Enter TRUE for Value, and click Create.
If the configuration doesn't exist, click New , enter the following values in the New Page Setting window, and click Create.
FIELD	VALUE
Module	Shipping Options
Configuration	Show Ship Notes
Page	all
Value	TRUE
Build and activate a new configuration cache.
